changelog_entries.title: Apply one more change to reduce stutters further
Fix song select undo-random changing collection
Keep other players ready when one changes teams in multiplayer
Fix lazer - stable - lazer replay round trip causing import failure
Warn users about rate limited private messages, rather than warning moderators
Adjust process priority when game mode is enabled
changelog_entries.message:
A small number of users have been reporting stutters caused by running discord and osu! at the same time with game mode enabled. It's likely dependent on hardware, as we cannot reproduce thus far.

We'll continue investigating the underlying cause for this, but I'm pushing out a hotfix which alleviates the issue for now.
changelog_entries.message_html:
A small number of users have been reporting stutters caused by running discord and osu! at the same time with game mode enabled. It's likely dependent on hardware, as we cannot reproduce thus far.

We'll continue investigating the underlying cause for this, but I'm pushing out a hotfix which alleviates the issue for now.

changelog_entries.title: Cap maximum spinner RPM based on OD
changelog_entries.message:
The RPM required to **clear** spinners (i.e. minimum RPM) is unchanged from stable and the previous implementation:

| OD | RPM |
| --- | --- |
| 0 | 90 |
| 5 | 150 |
| 10 | 225 |

With this PR, the RPM required to **complete** spinners becomes:

| OD | RPM |
| --- | --- |
| 0 | 250 |
| 5 | 380 |
| 10 | 430 |

To come to these values, I've taken a mix of:
- Watching players I could find on YouTube, trying to take a healthy mix of all skill levels.
- My personal experience as what I would consider an "advanced" player but someone that has never cared about getting full score on spinners.
- Spinning through a remote desktop connection + mouse. This artifically lowers my skill.

My (rough, biased, not rooted in absolute fact) observations from this are:
- New players tend to range around 200-280 RPM.
- Intermediate players tend to range around 250-320 RPM.
- Advanced players tend to range around 320-380 RPM.
- Expert players tend to sit comfortably around 450 RPM.
- Even top players - those that are considered good at the game, tend to sit in the 300-400 RPM range

Keep in mind, however, that:
- OD is skewed upwards such that it is more typical for even new players to see ODs >= 4. Those at the advanced level, for example, are usually going to see at least OD >= 7 (~405 RPM) which should still give them a bit of a challenge (at least they'll need to _try_).
- Once you reach 6*, which is not considered hard these days, it's rare to see OD < 8.
- RPM isn't consistent - there's ramp-up time whether caused by acceleration (stable) or by the player realising they need to start spinning.
changelog_entries.message_html:
The RPM required to clear spinners (i.e. minimum RPM) is unchanged from stable and the previous implementation:

OD RPM
0 90
5 150
10 225

With this PR, the RPM required to complete spinners becomes:

OD RPM
0 250
5 380
10 430

To come to these values, I've taken a mix of:

  • Watching players I could find on YouTube, trying to take a healthy mix of all skill levels.
  • My personal experience as what I would consider an "advanced" player but someone that has never cared about getting full score on spinners.
  • Spinning through a remote desktop connection + mouse. This artifically lowers my skill.

My (rough, biased, not rooted in absolute fact) observations from this are:

  • New players tend to range around 200-280 RPM.
  • Intermediate players tend to range around 250-320 RPM.
  • Advanced players tend to range around 320-380 RPM.
  • Expert players tend to sit comfortably around 450 RPM.
  • Even top players - those that are considered good at the game, tend to sit in the 300-400 RPM range

Keep in mind, however, that:

  • OD is skewed upwards such that it is more typical for even new players to see ODs >= 4. Those at the advanced level, for example, are usually going to see at least OD >= 7 (~405 RPM) which should still give them a bit of a challenge (at least they'll need to try).
  • Once you reach 6*, which is not considered hard these days, it's rare to see OD < 8.
  • RPM isn't consistent - there's ramp-up time whether caused by acceleration (stable) or by the player realising they need to start spinning.

changelog_entries.title: Fix SR/BPM display showing no info in multiplayer playlist rooms
Fix storyboard `UseSkinSprites` being implemented incorrectly
changelog_entries.message: This was implemented as a "fallback", but it's actually intended to be an "override". As in it allows storyboarders to *prefer* a skin sprite before falling back to a local version contained within the storyboard.
changelog_entries.message_html: This was implemented as a "fallback", but it's actually intended to be an "override". As in it allows storyboarders to prefer a skin sprite before falling back to a local version contained within the storyboard.

changelog_entries.message_html: Includes fixes for several languages that had the wrong country code mapping causing translations to not actually display.

changelog_entries.title: Add edge highlight to "argon" slider repeat arrow (and improve all skins' reverse arrow animations)
changelog_entries.message:
This addresses concerns about visibility of repeat arrows on short sliders by adding a border element which animated outwards.

I've also fixed multiple inconsistencies when compared to stable, including disabling beat sync and having the animation start as soon as the hit object appears. This helps *massively* with visibility, as otherwise the animation may not start until much later. It also looks better as every slider is not longer synchronised to the same animation cycle.

<video width="80%" controls><source src="https://github.com/ppy/osu/assets/191335/778f65c2-a924-49ef-9bab-36410a258f20" type="video/mp4" preload="none"></video>

<video width="80%" controls><source src="https://github.com/ppy/osu/assets/191335/32113567-0709-4fd4-9ebc-9d6087e2aba0" type="video/mp4" preload="none"></video>
changelog_entries.message_html:
This addresses concerns about visibility of repeat arrows on short sliders by adding a border element which animated outwards.

I've also fixed multiple inconsistencies when compared to stable, including disabling beat sync and having the animation start as soon as the hit object appears. This helps massively with visibility, as otherwise the animation may not start until much later. It also looks better as every slider is not longer synchronised to the same animation cycle.

changelog_entries.title: Tidy up `LegacyLastTickOffset` usages and stop passing everywhere
Disable linux video hardware acceleration for now
Fix race condition in ThreadedTaskScheduler when adding tasks
Fix spinner requirements being susceptible to FP precision
Fix source clock not correctly getting started after a decoupled transition
Crop oversized gameplay textures instead of downscaling them
Allow judging at most one swell tick per frame
changelog_entries.message: This changes swell input handling such that only one swell tick can be judged in a given update frame. This is supposed to curtail cases wherein a user binds (either in-game, or via external tools) all four taiko actions to one key, to knock out four hits at a time with one key.
changelog_entries.message_html: This changes swell input handling such that only one swell tick can be judged in a given update frame. This is supposed to curtail cases wherein a user binds (either in-game, or via external tools) all four taiko actions to one key, to knock out four hits at a time with one key.

changelog_entries.title: Allow "Difficulty Adjust" mod's extended AR selection to go below zero
changelog_entries.message:
Adds the ability to set negative ARs down to -10 to the difficulty adjust mod for osu!standard (for the extended range), and adds millisecond value information to the selection slider when the extended limits are active to explain what "negative AR" even is.

![Adjustment screen](https://gn.s-ul.eu/jp4AzMOW)

changelog_entries.title: Apply further fixes to note lock when classic mod is enabled
changelog_entries.message: This change in particular moves across an edge case from stable wherein slider heads will always block input from reaching objects underneath them, until the slider is fully completed.

changelog_entries.title: Update osu! spinner ticks calculation method to better match osu!(stable)
changelog_entries.message: osu!(stable) calculates the spins requirement for completion in "half spins", meanwhile lazer tried to do roughly the same but applied a slightly overestimated 0.6x factor to "convert" into full spins. This PR updates the number of spins required to be closer to expectations.
changelog_entries.message_html: osu!(stable) calculates the spins requirement for completion in "half spins", meanwhile lazer tried to do roughly the same but applied a slightly overestimated 0.6x factor to "convert" into full spins. This PR updates the number of spins required to be closer to expectations.

changelog_entries.title: Add two spins gap before awarding bonus score on osu! spinners
changelog_entries.message: As it turns out, in previous lazer versions a player could gain two extra bonus spins on any spinner in any map compared to stable. For the sake of balancing, this PR mimics stable behaviour and adds a gap of two spins which need to be performed after required spins in order to receive bonus score.
changelog_entries.message_html: As it turns out, in previous lazer versions a player could gain two extra bonus spins on any spinner in any map compared to stable. For the sake of balancing, this PR mimics stable behaviour and adds a gap of two spins which need to be performed after required spins in order to receive bonus score.

changelog_entries.title: Remove slider head circle movement (and remove setting from "classic" mod)
changelog_entries.message:
I've gone with the most simple approach animation wise, which feels quite good to me: the snaking path will only begin snaking after the head circle is hit. I can see that others came to roughly the same consensus in the original discussion, so I don't think there will be too much contention over this change.

Things to note:

- I considered having the slider ball not appear until the head is hit, but I don't think a change like this would sit well as it would potentially reduce readability
- I intentionally made the snaking only happen on a successful hit. So if you miss the slider head completely, the outwards snaking will never complete. This could be a good visual cue.
- The original plan I had animation wise was to have the portion of path before the slider ball's current position fade out on slider head hit, but this would mean duplicating the slider path. And I don't think this is a good idea from a performance perspective for such an edge case.

Here's how it looks in slow motion:

<video width="80%" controls><source src="https://github.com/ppy/osu/assets/191335/75931867-2890-47c7-b963-f553a0b6cc80" type="video/mp4" preload="none"></video>

It's important to note that in the majority of cases, these kinds of sliders are so fast you can't even catch this visually. It's usually hidden under the head / tail. Even when it's not, it's hard to catch:

<video width="80%" controls><source src="https://github.com/ppy/osu/assets/191335/82db9ea2-dd7a-485e-a4ae-45eaa959439b" type="video/mp4" preload="none"></video>

Finally, here's what missing a slider head completely looks like:

<video width="80%" controls><source src="https://github.com/ppy/osu/assets/191335/4bd0ffb4-bfa1-4cee-bd93-98e49c829762" type="video/mp4" preload="none"></video>

(basically, as if snaking was not enabled)
changelog_entries.message_html:
I've gone with the most simple approach animation wise, which feels quite good to me: the snaking path will only begin snaking after the head circle is hit. I can see that others came to roughly the same consensus in the original discussion, so I don't think there will be too much contention over this change.

Things to note:

  • I considered having the slider ball not appear until the head is hit, but I don't think a change like this would sit well as it would potentially reduce readability
  • I intentionally made the snaking only happen on a successful hit. So if you miss the slider head completely, the outwards snaking will never complete. This could be a good visual cue.
  • The original plan I had animation wise was to have the portion of path before the slider ball's current position fade out on slider head hit, but this would mean duplicating the slider path. And I don't think this is a good idea from a performance perspective for such an edge case.

Here's how it looks in slow motion:

It's important to note that in the majority of cases, these kinds of sliders are so fast you can't even catch this visually. It's usually hidden under the head / tail. Even when it's not, it's hard to catch:

Finally, here's what missing a slider head completely looks like:

(basically, as if snaking was not enabled)

changelog_entries.title: Refactor storyboard resource lookup to be more streamlined
Fix game mode not triggering on new macOS versions
Default to normal bank if invalid sample bank is specified
changelog_entries.message: Some existing beatmaps specify an invalid sample bank in the `.osu` file. While stable would fallback to the normal sample bank, lazer would - until now - just refuse to play the sample. This change replicates the behaviour of stable.
changelog_entries.message_html: Some existing beatmaps specify an invalid sample bank in the .osu file. While stable would fallback to the normal sample bank, lazer would - until now - just refuse to play the sample. This change replicates the behaviour of stable.

changelog_entries.title: Fix broken automatic beatmap download setting migration
Fix issues after storyboard resource lookup refactor
Highlight friend's scores in gameplay leaderboards
changelog_entries.message: ![image](https://github.com/ppy/osu/assets/34775378/b802d928-aa67-4674-86b2-8f3dd99e2597)

changelog_entries.title: Fix sliders not always being the correct length on some more beatmaps
changelog_entries.message: Fixes another [edge case beatmap](https://osu.ppy.sh/beatmapsets/10804#osu/42196) wherein some sliders were too short.
changelog_entries.message_html: Fixes another edge case beatmap wherein some sliders were too short.

changelog_entries.title: Avoid throwing exception when attempting to access `WebRequest` response in fail path
Add ability to toggle velocity change visualisation in osu!taiko and osu!mania editors
changelog_entries.message:
Stable never had this, and it's more natural to edit in linear speed.

<video width="80%" controls><source src="https://github.com/ppy/osu/assets/191335/07512a9b-fc6c-4255-b0e4-5508bf5e9e4a" type="video/mp4" preload="none"></video>
changelog_entries.message_html: Stable never had this, and it's more natural to edit in linear speed.

changelog_entries.title: Bump OpenTabletDriver to 0.6.3.0
changelog_entries.message: Added support for over 30 new tablets. Improved support for many already supported ones. Fixed some bugs.
changelog_entries.message_html: Added support for over 30 new tablets. Improved support for many already supported ones. Fixed some bugs.

changelog_entries.title: Don't block cut/copy platform actions on empty textbox selection
Update clocks in line with framework changes
Fix shift-delete not working at song select
changelog_entries.message: In combination with https://github.com/ppy/osu-framework/pull/5997, closes https://github.com/ppy/osu/issues/24867
changelog_entries.message_html: In combination with https://github.com/ppy/osu-framework/pull/5997, closes https://github.com/ppy/osu/issues/24867

Add Catch the Beat Indonesia Cup 2023 wiki article
Add `Project Loved: Six Years / September 2023` news post
Add opengraph header to user profile
CI: only warn about commit fetching failures when they really happen
Remove unused server-side build icon function
Fix artist tracks search form class
Add missing cast for Contest show_votes
Add beatmap max combo column and rename attrib based subquery column
Update Tournament Committee article moving Azer to Alumni
Match object docs with TypeScript interface
Add user table column to lock changing email
Fix button area changing height when disabled
Fix sending multi-line message plain text chat error
Workaround beatmap discussions reply box having wrong background colour
Add changes to official tournament support from July 2023 TC meeting
Update `Official Tournament Support` deadline for submission of Badge Requests
Update "last updated" date for `Official tournament support`
Speed up assets building on non-native platform
Move WIP/pending beatmaps to graveyard when approving their beatmapset
Add API route for kudosu ranking
Add beatmapset search param for beatmapset events
Revert recent SSBO optimisations
changelog_entries.message: After pushing the SSBO masking changes to users, it turned out that the change was not an unambiguous performance win as originally hoped, and as such has been reverted for now in order to avoid diverting focus further away from more important concerns.
changelog_entries.message_html: After pushing the SSBO masking changes to users, it turned out that the change was not an unambiguous performance win as originally hoped, and as such has been reverted for now in order to avoid diverting focus further away from more important concerns.
